Subject: EPP Server and Console Accessible Issue
Description:
Hi Team,

We are unable to access the EPP server and console. Kindly check and resolve the issues with priority.

Palvannan.T
9940571412
What_We_Know__c:
30/04/2025

Client is facing issues with accessing the EPP Console.

2025.05.01
We had a remote session and in our remote session we discovered that the disk space usage for customer's Endpoint Protector appliance was 500GB which filled up the physical hard disk of their hypervisor leaving no free disk space, this created an issue whereby the EPP Server Appliance could not run and function properly and thus the reason why they could not access the web UI of their EPP Server.  Customer allocated 320 GB of the physical hard disk to their EPP Server Appliance but 500 GB was used.  This is because the other 180 GB was utilized by the 6 snapshots that were stored.
After they have deleted the older snapshots, they managed to free up the 180 GB and when they rebooted their EPP Sever appliance we observed that it resumed to operate normally as expected.
Next_Steps__c:
30/04/2025
Sent note to gather details.

2025.05.01
Customer needs to run audit log backups and then provide us with a status update on this support ticket and let us know if they would require additional assistance or if we may we proceed to close this case.

2025.05.22
I sent the customer a follow up email asking for a status update on this ticket.
Solution_Comment__c:
2025.05.22
We had a remote session and in our remote session we discovered that the disk space usage for customer's Endpoint Protector appliance was 500GB which filled up the physical hard disk of their hypervisor leaving no free disk space, this created an issue whereby the EPP Server Appliance could not run and function properly and thus the reason why they could not access the web UI of their EPP Server.  Customer allocated 320 GB of the physical hard disk to their EPP Server Appliance but 500 GB was used.  This is because the other 180 GB was utilized by the 6 snapshots that were stored.
After they have deleted the older snapshots, they managed to free up the 180 GB and when they rebooted their EPP Sever appliance we observed that it resumed to operate normally as expected.

Customer confirmed that issue is solved and that the case can be closed.
